The giraffe (Giraffa) is a genus of African even-toed ungulate mammals, the tallest living terrestrial animals and the largest ruminants.
The giraffe is a genus of African even-toed ungulate mammals, the tallest living terrestrial animals and the largest ruminants.
A giraffe is an African even-toed ungulate mammal, the tallest living terrestrial animal and the largest ruminant.

The giraffe is an African even-toed ungulate mammal, the tallest living terrestrial animal and the largest ruminant. Its species name refers to its camel-like face and the patches of color on its fur, which bear a vague resemblance to a leopard's spots.
The giraffe (Giraffa) is an African artiodactyl mammal, the tallest living terrestrial animal and the largest ruminant.

The giraffe is an African even-toed ungulate mammal, the tallest living terrestrial animal and the largest ruminant. Its species name refers to its camel-like shape and its leopard-like coloring. Its chief distinguishing characteristics are its extremely long neck and legs, its horn-like ossicones, and its distinctive coat patterns.
A giraffe is a mammal which is the tallest of all land-living animal species, and the largest ruminants.
The giraffe is an African even-toed ungulate mammal, the tallest living terrestrial animal and the largest ruminant.
Giraffes are the tallest mammals in the world.
A giraffe is a mammal that lives in Africa.
Giraffes are the tallest living animals in the world. The males (bulls) may exceed 5.5 metres (18 feet) in height, and the tallest females (cows) are about 4.5 metres (15 feet).
Giraffes are mammals with long necks, long legs, and spotted coats.
Giraffes are mammals of the family Giraffidae in the order Artiodactyla.

A mammal is any vertebrate animal belonging to the class Mammalia, and characterized by the possession of a neocortex (a region of the brain), hair, three middle ear bones, and mammary glands functional in mothers with young.

Mammals are a class of vertebrate, air-breathing animals whose females are characterized by the possession of mammary glands while both males and females are characterized by sweat glands, hair and/or fur, three middle ear bones used in hearing, and a neocortex region in the brain.
